definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: To choose the catchword of 2008, Simulated Culture must be included.
sentences.chinese: 評選2008年流行語，“山寨”當有一席之地。

sentences.english: This paper mainly analyzes catchphrases in China.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要對當代中國的流行語進行分析。

sentences.english: Hereby, the paper focuses the discussion on popular dialects and social catchphrases.
sentences.chinese: 在此，重點探討一下方言流行語和社會流行語。

sentences.english: Hereby, the paper focuses the discussion on popular dialects and social catchphrases.
sentences.chinese: 在此，重點探討一下方言流行語和社會流行語。

sentences.english: Pardonable also the catchword this year is particularly popular.
sentences.chinese: 也難怪今年的流行語非凡流行。

sentences.english: As always, “stability” is the catchword for China.
sentences.chinese: 一如既往，“穩定”是描述中國的流行語。
他突然想到這句流行語。

sentences.english: It also ventures to identify the various causes underlying semantic uncertainness of catchwords.
sentences.chinese: 同時討論了導致流行語語義不確定性的原因。

sentences.english: Into the village of staff Catchwords.
sentences.chinese: 成爲村裏工作人員的流行語。

sentences.english: One thing we have plenty of in the enterprise software industry are buzzwords.
sentences.chinese: 企業軟件行業中會大量出現流行語。

sentences.english: Campus'popular language is a mirror reflecting state of mind of modern collegians.
sentences.chinese: 校園流行語是反映大學生心理狀況的一面鏡子。

sentences.english: Today I'll show you some Chinese catchwords, now they were popularising in Chinese internet communities.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，流行語風行於中國互聯網的各大社區。

definition: to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
variant of 熱衷|热衷[re4 zhong1]

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
to keep a record of events/record/to start to form memories (after one's infancy)
tax levied on a conquered people by an army/fee for a divination session/variant of 氪金[ke4 jin1], in-app purchase (gaming)
